creator: frederic.mohier@wanadoo.fr
text:
Hi,
 I run tomcat 4.1.12 with apache 1.3.27 and the mod_webapp.so. Sometimes, I have
these logs made by catalina : 

2003-05-07 16:27:45 [org.apache.catalina.connector.warp.WarpConnection]
Exception on socket
java.net.SocketException: socket closed: Bad file number
        at java.net.SocketInputStream.socketRead(Native Method)
        at java.net.SocketInputStream.read(SocketInputStream.java:85)
        at java.net.SocketInputStream.read(SocketInputStream.java:107)
        at org.apache.catalina.connector.warp.WarpConnection.recv(Unknown Source
)
        at org.apache.catalina.connector.warp.WarpRequestHandler.handle(Unknown
Source)
        at org.apache.catalina.connector.warp.WarpConnection.run(Unknown Source)
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:479)

2003-05-07 16:27:45 [org.apache.catalina.connector.warp.WarpConnector] Error
accepting requests
java.net.SocketException: Socket closed
        at java.net.PlainSocketImpl.socketAccept(Native Method)
        at java.net.PlainSocketImpl.accept(PlainSocketImpl.java:463)
        at java.net.ServerSocket.implAccept(ServerSocket.java:238)
        at java.net.ServerSocket.accept(ServerSocket.java:217)
        at org.apache.catalina.connector.warp.WarpConnector.run(Unknown Source)
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:479)

2003-05-07 16:27:45 [org.apache.catalina.connector.warp.WarpConnection]
Exception on socket
java.net.SocketException: socket closed: Bad file number
        at java.net.SocketInputStream.socketRead(Native Method)
        at java.net.SocketInputStream.read(SocketInputStream.java:85)
        at java.net.SocketInputStream.read(SocketInputStream.java:107)
        at org.apache.catalina.connector.warp.WarpConnection.recv(Unknown Source)
        at org.apache.catalina.connector.warp.WarpRequestHandler.handle(Unknown
Source)
        at org.apache.catalina.connector.warp.WarpConnection.run(Unknown Source)
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:479)

 Any help ? Thanks ...

Unfortuneately, mod_webapp is not supported by the developers any more (due to
lack of interest). So you have 2 alternatives:
- Use jk (or jk2)
- Upgrade to 4.1.24 - and hope the issue was NOT isolated to mod_webapp and the
problem goes away.
